column4: hmm I had to reinstall windows and now I can no longer connect to my ubuntu box through putty says I am missing a ppk file
I dont seem to have this file anywhere backed up\
We don't support Windows here.
funny but the issue i am having is with the ssh ppk file for ubuntu not windows
You should leave at least 100MB for /boot, imo
Just saying
I set it to 250mb
Will do well.
the 20mb is for the efi
I'm not sure how the EFI works -- does it need a separate partition?
it seems to need to be at the very front of the drive
Probably some big udev/automount problem
any idea how to fix?
Just report a bug, cross your fingers and hope for it
hmm there is nothing I can try like reinstalling or adding somethinng to fstab? cause I mean I was able to install ubuntu via cd
No idea, really, if we could get some logs on wtf is happening when you insert a CD, dmesg perhaps...
hmm it seems that pastie.org does not like text larger then 64k
Try pzt.me, I always use that one... And we don't need all of it, just the parts which happen after you insert the cd
ok http://paste.ubuntu.com/704541
sorry that it is the whole thing but I have no idea where to look
It looks normal, unless I missed something (it's huge)
it is huge and no it looks normal to me too
also shouldnt there be something in the fstab?
No, CD-ROMS aren't static
